Package socialmedia

Class Account

  • java.lang.Object
    • socialmedia.Account
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Account
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class contains all the methods and attributes of the Account and therefore is responsible for handling all the details related to a user on the Social Media Platform.

    An Account has a unique ID (sequencially incremennting acording to num of users on the system), a string handle (username) and a description similar to a bio.

    The class itself has a static value for its SerialVersionUID used when serializing the platform, a num of accounts which tracks the number of accounts created and a HashSet of all usernames (handles).

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Account​(java.lang.String handle)

      Account​(java.lang.String handle, java.lang.String description)
      This is the constructor method for an Account, it takes in the parameters handle which will be the username of the account, and the description which will be connected to the account.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Account

        public Account​(java.lang.String handle)
        throws IllegalHandleException,
               InvalidHandleException
        This is the constructor method for an Account, it takes in the parameter handle which will be the username of the account. This constructor is for when the user does not want to add a description on the creation of their account.
        Parameters:
        handle - The username the user wants to use.
        Throws:
        IllegalHandleException - Thrown if the handle is already in use.
        InvalidHandleException - Thrown if the handle is over 30 characters, is empty, or contains white space.

      • Account

        public Account​(java.lang.String handle,
               java.lang.String description)
        throws IllegalHandleException,
               InvalidHandleException
        This is the constructor method for an Account, it takes in the parameters handle which will be the username of the account, and the description which will be connected to the account.
        Parameters:
        handle - The username the user wants to use.
        description - The description the user wants to display.
        Throws:
        IllegalHandleException - Thrown if the handle is already in use.
        InvalidHandleException - Thrown if the handle is over 30 characters, is empty, or contains white space.

    • Method Detail

      • resetNumAccounts

        public static void resetNumAccounts()
        This method resets the number of posts to 0.

      • changeHandle

        public void changeHandle​(java.lang.String newHandle)
                  throws InvalidHandleException
        This method is for allowing the user the change their handle after creating their account. It does all the checks to be sure there are no other users with the new handle.
        Parameters:
        newHandle - This is the handle that the user wants to change to.
        Throws:
        InvalidHandleException - This exception is thrown if the handle is under 30 characters, is blank, or contains white space.

      • updateDescription

        public void updateDescription​(java.lang.String description)
        This method allows the user to update their account description.
        Parameters:
        description - The new description that they want to add.
